page.title: 06The Labour Club, Patchway
page.content: To join this club you have to pay Â£2.60 every year. It is open to everyone over 18 years of age. It began in Hazeldene Road in 1950, and was moved to the new club building in Coniston Parade in 1969. It was opened by L.W.Bosisto Esq J.P. He was the club founder and president. The club has a lounge, a function room and a hall. In the lounge people can buy drinks and snacks, play bingo, darts, skittles, pool and snooker. There is a T.V. and Video, fruit machines and a "Space Invader" game in the lounge too. A dance is held in the every Saturday. The function room is used for parties etc. I have been in the bingo hall with my mum, nanny and grandad. Once I won Â£2.60. Children aren't allowed to go in there any more as it is very rough. Often it is noisy and some people have fights.
